column4: anyone know if there is a way of performing the nvidia-settings tweaking of external displays from the command line?
I think what you want is nvidia-xconfig, though I'm not sure.
I don't want to rewrite the xconfig, I'd like to toggle the external monitor without having to invoke the nvidia-settings gui and clicking a bunch...
what do you mean by "toggle the external monitor"?
turn external monitor on laptop on and off (dual monitor when docked, single when undocked)
ah, ok.  I don't know if there's anything like that for nvidia, unless they support the xrandr extensions.  I don't think that works if you've set up the monitors through xinerama though.
I've not used xinerama, just the nvidia twinview config
ok.  Just read the nvidia docs and the xrandr docs I guess, that's all the info I have.
that's where I'm hitting a wall...
disper is what I wanted :)   http://willem.engen.nl/projects/disper/
thanks for the info, I'll keep that in mind :)
I just came across it, have been using xrandr and nvidia's meta-modes in xorg.conf for a few years now.  This is much better.
yeah, crazy nvidia and their meta modes.  Found out about those when I was wondering why in the world my card/monitor was only working at 50 Hz.  Just crazy nvidia trickery.
ah yes, the "use the refresh rate to make xrandr modes appear unique" trick.
yeah.  It's sad that for good 3d on linux you need to used closed drivers that pull that kind of nonsense.  I hope that hte open ATI ones get much better soon, or the nouveux guys get a lot of help.
